title: Add "Mix" page route & layout (UUID-based)
description: Create a new route /mix/:mixId where mixId is a UUID that uniquely identifies a collaboration session. Build the top‑level MixPage layout (header, ingredient list, recipe‑URL form). Initialise a stubbed empty mix state so the UI works before the backend exists.

title: Design "Mix" UI components + Add-Ingredient dialog
description: Implement reusable UI components: MixHeader (title + share button), IngredientList (list with optional checkboxes), RecipeUrlForm (text input + submit button), and an AddIngredientDialog modal opened via an actionable Add Ingredient button.

title: Stub recipe-URL submission flow
description: Wire the RecipeUrlForm to a client‑side stub that shows a loading spinner, then a success toast after a short delay. No real POST request is made yet; the stub will be replaced when the API endpoint is ready.

title: Stub WebSocket integration & message types
description: Set up a placeholder WebSocket connection (e.g., ws://localhost:8080) and register expected message types: ingredient_added, ingredient_removed, mix_updated. When these messages are received (you can simulate them), update the UI accordingly. No real server needed yet.

title: Stub participant-name dialog
description: Add a button that opens a modal dialog prompting the user to enter a display name. Store the name in local storage / component state and show it alongside any ingredients they add. This is a client‑side stub; no backend persistence yet.

title: Accessibility & responsive styling
description: Ensure all new components meet WCAG AA: proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus management, sufficient color contrast, and responsive layout for mobile devices.

title: E2E Cypress (or Playwright) tests for Mix page (stubs)
description: Write end‑to‑end Cypress (or Playwright) tests covering the stubbed flows: page loads with UUID, recipe URL submission shows loading → success, adding an ingredient via dialog updates list, participant‑name dialog stores and displays name, simulated WebSocket messages update UI.
